content:
I created a new stream and included all current members in it. This is a place where everyone should feel welcome to talk about topics that are not related to Backdrop CMS, including what is happening in the world today and how they are coping with it.

Our Code of Conduct applies here, as everywhere, and we ask that people use this stream responsibly.
Thanks. Where to I post HELP questions, for instance I was setting up BackDrop on MAMP and got a database error. Where do I ask for help...?

Hi, Sarvasri. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU
@Sarvasri Posting here is fine. Even better in the "Backdrop" stream. Just choose a new topic like "Installation problem" there, describe what happened and ask for help.
I searched "Installation" and found a relevant topic and couldn't find a way to post the question. I could only reply to existing posts.
@Sarvasri don't worry too much about it :smile: ...just ask the question, and one of us will move it to the right place.
This topic was moved by klonos to #Backdrop > Installation question

Upon further review the old D7 sites did not make use of ckeditor. It's not installed. All of the body fields just contain html and css. All of the photos are in an images folder, not sites/default/files, don't know how they get there. Not cool. Makes me wonder why Drupal was even used. There's no custom content types or fields. There are a lot of WordPress sites, which makes sense if entering content in Drupal required html knowledge. I have a lot of work to do.
